description.narrative: The project development objectives are (a) to improve road services on two main national corridors and the provincial road network, (b) to rehabilitate roads damaged by Typhoon Ketsana, and (c) to establish and operationalize a contingency fund for quick disaster response in the road sector.

participating-org.narrative: Ministry Of Public Works and Transport

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section C, para 6 | Description :At least 60 days before starting works, publicly disseminate ESOM,RPF and EGDF and undertake required environmental and social actions & provide compensation in accordance with RAP & RPF |Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I-A, para 4 | Description :The Recipient shall increase the revenue basis for the RMF,including increasing levies on motor vehecle fuel to a level of not less than 400 Kip per liter. | Due Date :30-Jun-2012

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I-A, para 5 | Description :MWPT shall prepare and submit to IDA a draft annual work programfor national and provincial road and bridge preservation and a thre e- year rolling preservation plan. | Frequency :Yearly
Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I-A, para 6 | Description :MPWT shall update ther National Transport Strategic Plan,including a medium- term expenditure program. | Due Date :30-Jun-2013

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I-A, para 7 | Description :The recipient/MPWT shall contract an external audit firm underToR satisfactory to IDA and project internal audit consultants underT oR satisfactory to IDA | Due Date :01-Oct-2010
Finance Agreement :Schedule 2,Section I-B | Description :Carry out project in accordance with Anti-Corruption Guidelines |Frequency :Yearly
